Name: Tanners and Fellmongers
Description (tasks and duties): Workers in this unit group make leather from hides and skins. Their functions include: sorting and grading hides and skins; removing residual wool from sheepskins; removing flesh and hair from hides by hand or machine: operating machine to split hides edgeways; treating hides to convert them into leather; dressing and applying dyes and stains to leather; performing related tasks.

Name: Pelt Dressers
Description (tasks and duties): Workers in this unit group prepare fur- or wool-bearing pelts for making garments and other products. Their functions include: sorting pelts before or after dressing; removing flesh and fat from pelts before curing; removing long, coarse hair form fur pelts and trimming underlying hair to even length; stretching and smoothing dressed pelts; performing related tasks.
